name: UITableViewDropDelegate
desc: The interface for handling drops in a table view.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, canHandle: UIDropSession) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks your delegate whether it can accept the specified type of data.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, dropPreviewParametersForRowAt: IndexPath) -> UIDragPreviewParameters?
items.desc: Returns custom information about how to display the row at the specified location during the drop.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, performDropWith: UITableViewDropCoordinator)
items.desc: Incorporates the dropped data into your data structures and updates the table.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, dropSessionDidUpdate: UIDropSession, withDestinationIndexPath: IndexPath?) -> UITableViewDropProposal
items.desc: Proposes how to handle a drop at the specified location in the table view.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, dropSessionDidEnter: UIDropSession)
items.desc: Called when dragged content enters the table view's bounds rectangle.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, dropSessionDidExit: UIDropSession)
items.desc: Called when dragged content exits the table view's bounds rectangle.

items.name: func tableView(UITableView, dropSessionDidEnd: UIDropSession)
items.desc: Called to notify you when the drag operation ends.
